analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don gyi go rims kyi rten yin no //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the meaning of the word ‘bodhisattva’ in a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom does not stand or exist anywhere.” This is the basis of the order of the benefit for others.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'od la gnas med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'od la gnas med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: the light of the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas does not stand or exist anywhere.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the word-meaning of ‘bodhisattva’ is not found and is not apprehended in the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang ldan pa ma yin mi ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang ldan pa ma yin mi ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because all those dharmas—that is, awakening, bodhisattva, and the word-meaning of ‘bodhisattva’—are not conjoined and not disjoined;

original: gzugs med pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang / bstan du med pa dang / thogs pa med pa /
translated: they are formless, cannot be pointed out, do not obstruct,

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: and have only one mark—

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: that is, no mark.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings

original: rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi chags pa med pa nyid dang / yod par gyur pa ma yin pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi chags pa med pa nyid dang / yod par gyur pa ma yin pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: and the non-existence of all dharmas, one should train in the non-attachment and non-existence of all dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ye shes lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ye shes lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'i rten yin no //
translated: “The bodhisattva mahāsattva should realize all dharmas” is the basis for the effortless engagement of wisdom.

original: 'di dag gis ni sgrub pa'i rten bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni sgrub pa'i rten bstan to //
translated: These explain the basis of practice.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni gang lags /
translated: Subhūti said, “Bhagavān, what are all dharmas?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar chos thams cad kyi yod par gyur pa ma yin pa nyid la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar chos thams cad kyi yod par gyur pa ma yin pa nyid la bslab par bgyi /
translated: Bhagavān, how should the bodhisattva mahāsattva train in the non-existence of all dharmas?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad rtogs par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad rtogs par bgyi /
translated: Bhagavān, how should the bodhisattva mahāsattva realize all dharmas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied,

original: @181b rab 'byor chos thams cad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: @181b rab 'byor chos thams cad ces bya ba ni /
translated: “Subhūti, ‘all dharmas’ means

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang /
translated: the wholesome, the unwholesome, the indeterminate, the mundane, the supramundane, the contaminated, the uncontaminated, the conditioned, the unconditioned,

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / thun mong ba dang / thun mong ma yin pa dag ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / thun mong ba dang / thun mong ma yin pa dag ste /
translated: the reprehensible, the irreproachable, the ordinary, and the extraordinary.

original: rab 'byor de dag ni chos thams cad ces bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de dag ni chos thams cad ces bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, these are called all dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang /
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas

original: chos de dag thams cad kyi yod par gyur pa ma yin pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad kyi yod par gyur pa ma yin pa nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: should train in the non-existence of all these dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos 'di dag rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos 'di dag rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin no //
translated: This is the essence of the object of observation.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i chos gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i chos gang lags /
translated: He said, Bhagavan, what are mundane wholesome dharmas?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied,

original: rab 'byor 'jig rten pa'i chos dge ba zhes bya ba ni phar shes pa dang / mar shes pa dang / dge sbyong du shes pa dang / bram zer shes pa dang / rigs kyi rgan pa la rim gror byed pa dang / sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'jig rten pa'i chos dge ba zhes bya ba ni phar shes pa dang / mar shes pa dang / dge sbyong du shes pa dang / bram zer shes pa dang / rigs kyi rgan pa la rim gror byed pa dang / sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang /
translated: “Subhūti, mundane virtuous dharmas” are the recognition of father, the recognition of mother, the recognition of a spiritual practitioner, the recognition of a brahmin, the respect for the elders of the family, the meritorious deeds that arise from generosity,

original: tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / nyams su blang ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po dang / thabs mkhas pa dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / nyams su blang ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po dang / thabs mkhas pa dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang /
translated: the meritorious deeds that arise from morality, the meritorious deeds that arise from meditation, the things that are practiced, skillful means, the ten virtuous actions,

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'du shes dgu ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'du shes dgu ste /
translated: and the nine mundane perceptions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par rnags pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par dmar ba'i 'du shes dang / rnam par bsngos pa pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par zos pa pa'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par rnags pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par dmar ba'i 'du shes dang / rnam par bsngos pa pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par zos pa pa'i 'du shes dang /
translated: the perception of a bloated corpse, the perception of a festering corpse, the perception of a livid corpse, the perception of a decomposing corpse, the perception of a corpse gnawed by worms,

original: rnam par 'thor ba pa'i 'du shes dang / rus pa pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par tshig pa pa'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba pa'i 'du shes dang / rus pa pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par tshig pa pa'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
translated: the perception of a scattered corpse, the perception of a corpse burned by fire, the perception of a corpse cut up by a butcher, the four worldly meditative concentrations, the four formless absorptions,🔽and the five mundane higher perceptions and the ten mundane recollections.

original: 'jig rten pa'i mngon par shes pa lnga dang / 'jig rten pa'i rjes su dran pa bcu ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i mngon par shes pa lnga dang / 'jig rten pa'i rjes su dran pa bcu ste /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge @182a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge @182a * //
translated: the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dharma,🔽the recollection of the Saṅgha,

original: 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / skye ba rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / skye ba rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dharma, the recollection of the Saṅgha, the recollection of morality, the recollection of the deity, the recollection of giving, the recollection of the devas, the recollection of breathing, the recollection of the body,

original: 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa dag ste /
translated: the recollection of death, and the recollection of the elements of the body.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i chos zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i chos zhes brjod do //
translated: These are called mundane good dharmas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten pa'i mi dge ba'i chos gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten pa'i mi dge ba'i chos gang lags /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Lord, what are mundane bad dharmas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag ste /
translated: “They are the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are🔽killing,

original: rab 'byor srog gcod pa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor srog gcod pa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos mi dge ba'o //
translated: Śāriputra, stealing,

original: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub mo dang / ngag 'khyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba dang /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub mo dang / ngag 'khyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba dang /
translated: taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, idle talk, covetousness, ill will, and wrong views;

original: khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal te /
analyzed: khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal te /
translated: anger, resentment, hypocrisy, malice, violence, envy, stinginess, pride, and wrong pride.

original: rab 'byor de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i mi dge ba'i chos zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i mi dge ba'i chos zhes brjod do //
translated: Subhūti, these are called the worldly unwholesome dharmas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das lung du ma bstan pa'i chos gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das lung du ma bstan pa'i chos gang lags /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, what are the indeterminate dharmas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i lus kyi las dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i ngag gi las dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i yid kyi las dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i dbang po lnga dang /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i lus kyi las dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i ngag gi las dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i yid kyi las dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i dbang po lnga dang /
translated: It is also the four unwholesome great elements, the five unwholesome faculties,

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i skye mched drug dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs med pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams dang / rnam par smin pa thams cad de /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i skye mched drug dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs med pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams dang / rnam par smin pa thams cad de /
translated: the six unwholesome sense bases, the unwholesome formless [absorptions], and the unwholesome aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de dag ni lung du ma bstan pa'i chos zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag ni lung du ma bstan pa'i chos zhes brjod do //
translated: All of these are called unwholesome phenomena.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten pa'i chos gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten pa'i chos gang lags /
translated: [The Bodhisattva] asked, “Blessed One, what are mundane phenomena?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang /🔽@182b dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos gzhan gang /
analyzed: rab 'byor phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / @182b dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos gzhan gang /
translated: Subhūti, the five aggregates, the twelve sense fields, the eighteen elements, the ten wholesome courses of action, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the five superknowledges,🔽and any other worldly dharmas,

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i chos gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i chos gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: and any other worldly dharmas,

original: 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos zhes brjod do //
translated: these are called worldly dharmas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos gang lags /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, what are supramundane dharmas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of magical power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa dang / mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa dang / mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang /
translated: the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, the wishlessness gate of liberation, the faculty producing complete knowledge, the faculty of complete knowledge,

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the faculty of possessing complete knowledge, the concentration with applied thought and sustained thought, the concentration without applied thought but with sustained thought, the concentration without applied thought and without sustained thought,

original: rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad de /
analyzed: rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad de /
translated: 5) proper mental activity, and🔽6-8) the eight liberations.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: gzugs can gzugs la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: 1) The first liberation is the perception of form by one who has form.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: 2) The second liberation is the perception of external forms by one who has no internal form.

original: sdug par mos pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //🔽gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /🔽thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes te /
analyzed: sdug par mos pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o // gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te / thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes te /
translated: 3) The third liberation is the perception of beauty.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: 4) The fourth liberation is the perception of infinite space.🔽5) The fifth liberation is the perception of infinite consciousness.🔽6) The sixth liberation is the perception of nothingness.🔽7) The seventh liberation is the perception of neither existence nor non-existence.🔽8) The eighth liberation is the perception of the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of infinite space,

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so zhes rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so zhes rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa lnga pa'o //
translated: he achieves and abides in the sphere of infinite consciousness, thinking, ‘Consciousness is infinite.’ This is the fifth liberation.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /🔽cung zad med do snyam pas ci yang med pa'i skye mched nye @183a * //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te / cung zad med do snyam pas ci yang med pa'i skye mched nye @183a * //
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of infinite consciousness,

original: bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //
translated: he achieves and abides in the sphere of nothingness, thinking, ‘There is nothing at all.’ This is the sixth liberation.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of nothingness,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //
translated: he achieves and abides in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception. This is the seventh liberation.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yid dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yid dag par 'das te /
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,🔽he achieves and abides in the cessation of perception and feeling. This is the eighth liberation.🔽“The four formless absorptions are as follows:

original: 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa brgyad pa ste /
translated: The eighth liberation is the attainment and abiding in the cessation of perception and sensation.

original: 'di dag ni rnam par thar pa brgyad do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnam par thar pa brgyad do //
translated: These are the eight liberations.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ste /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ste /
translated: There are nine serial absorptions.🔽What are the nine?

original: dgu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dgu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dod pas dben pa sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa /🔽rtog pa dang bcas /
analyzed: 'dod pas dben pa sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa / rtog pa dang bcas /
translated: The first absorption is the attainment and abiding in the first absorption, which is free from desires, free from negative and non-virtuous factors,

original: dpyod pa dang bcas /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas /
translated: with applied and sustained thought,🔽and with joy and bliss born of seclusion.

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: The second absorption is the attainment and abiding in the second absorption, which is free from applied and sustained thought,

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rnam par rtog pa med pa rnam par dpyod pa med pa /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rnam par rtog pa med pa rnam par dpyod pa med pa /
translated: with inner clarity,🔽and with joy and bliss born of concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms su gnas te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du btang snyoms su gnas te /
translated: He accomplishes and abides in the second concentration, which possesses joy and physical well-being born of concentration and is free of the investigation and analysis of the first concentration.🔽He accomplishes and abides in the third concentration, which is free of joy and is endowed with mindfulness and introspection, and is characterized by equanimity,🔽being mindful and fully aware, and experiencing physical well-being.

original: bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis de la dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la rnam par spyod pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba yang med /🔽sdug bsngal ba yang med /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis de la dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la rnam par spyod pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba yang med /🔽sdug bsngal ba yang med /
translated: He accomplishes and abides in the fourth concentration, which is free of both pleasure and pain and is endowed with pure mindfulness and equanimity.

original: btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: They completely transcend the discernment of physical form,🔽and the discernment of obstruction vanishes.

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam ste /
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam ste /
translated: They do not pay attention to the discernment of multiplicity, and so they think, ‘Space is infinite.’🔽They establish and maintain the sense field of infinite space.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las @183b yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las @183b yang dag par 'das te /
translated: They completely transcend the sense field of infinite space,

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam pas /
translated: and they think, ‘Consciousness is infinite.’🔽They establish and maintain the sense field of infinite consciousness.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: They completely transcend the sense field of infinite consciousness,🔽and they think, ‘There is nothing at all.’🔽They establish and maintain the sense field of nothing whatsoever.

original: cung zad med do snyam pas cung zad med pa'i skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: cung zad med do snyam pas cung zad med pa'i skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: They attain and abide in the sphere of nothingness by thinking, “There is nothing at all.”

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: They attain and abide in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception by completely transcending the sphere of nothingness.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa ste /
translated: They attain and abide in the cessation of perception and feeling by completely transcending the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'di dag ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o //
translated: These are the nine serial absorptions.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: They are the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of non-things, the emptiness of nature, the emptiness of non-nature, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the thirty-two major marks of a great person, the eighty minor marks, the four forms of purity, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct knowledge, the four forms of individual correct knowledge, the six forms of clairvoyance, the thirty-two major marks of a great person, the eighty minor marks, the four forms of purity, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct knowledge, the four forms of individual correct knowledge, the six forms of clairvoyance, the thirty-two major marks of a great person, the eighty minor marks, the four forms of purity, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct knowledge, the four forms of individual correct knowledge, the six forms of clairvoyance, the thirty-two major marks of a great person, the eighty minor marks, the four forms of purity, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct knowledge, the four forms of individual correct knowledge, the six forms of clairvoyance, the thirty-two major marks of a great person, the eighty minor marks, the four forms of purity, the four forms of fearlessness

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dag ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dag ste /
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called supramundane dharmas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subhūti then said, “Blessed One, what are contaminated dharmas?”

original: rab 'byor phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, the five aggregates, the twelve sense fields, the eighteen elements, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions.

original: de dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called contaminated dharmas.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das zag pa ma mchis pa'i chos gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das zag pa ma mchis pa'i chos gang lags /
translated: Subhūti then said, “Blessed One, what are uncontaminated dharmas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of magical power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ste /🔽de dag ni zag pa med pa'i @184a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ste / de dag ni zag pa med pa'i @184a * //
translated: the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: chos zhes bya'o //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'dus byas kyi chos gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: chos zhes bya'o // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'dus byas kyi chos gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: are called unconditioned phenomena.

original: rab 'byor 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subhūti, conditioned phenomena are called conditioned phenomena🔽because they are produced by causes and conditions.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / gzhan yang khams gsum par ma gtogs pa'i chos gang cung zad yod pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / gzhan yang khams gsum par ma gtogs pa'i chos gang cung zad yod pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ste /
translated: the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm, and also any other phenomena whatsoever that are not included in the three realms, up to and including the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya'o //
translated: “Those are called conditioned phenomena.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Blessed One, what are unconditioned phenomena?”

original: rab 'byor gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi mngon pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi mngon pa ste /
translated: “Subhūti, there is no arising, no passing away, and no transformation of anything that is other than a state of rest.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'dod chags zad pa /🔽zhe sdang zad pa /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'dod chags zad pa / zhe sdang zad pa /
translated: “They are as follows:🔽the exhaustion of desire,

original: gti mug zad pa /
analyzed: gti mug zad pa /
translated: the exhaustion of hatred,🔽the exhaustion of ignorance,

original: de bzhin nyid ma nor ba de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ma nor ba de bzhin nyid /
translated: suchness, unmistaken suchness,

original: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid /🔽chos nyid / chos kyi dbyings /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid / chos nyid / chos kyi dbyings /
translated: unchanging suchness,🔽the true nature of dharmas,

original: chos gnas pa nyid /
analyzed: chos gnas pa nyid /
translated: the dharma-constituent,🔽the establishment of dharmas,

original: chos nges pa nyid /
analyzed: chos nges pa nyid /
translated: The Dharma is ascertained.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The element of space and the perfect end.

original: rab 'byor de dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, these are called unconditioned dharmas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das thun mong gi chos gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das thun mong gi chos gang lags /
translated: ” He said, “Bhagavān, what are the shared dharmas?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Bhagavān said,

original: rab 'byor bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dag ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dag ste /
translated: “Subhūti, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, and the five superknowledges.

original: de dag ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang thun mong gi chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dang thun mong gi chos zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the shared dharmas of foolish, ordinary beings.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das thun mong ma lags pa'i chos gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das thun mong ma lags pa'i chos gang lags /
translated: ” He said, “Bhagavān, what are the unshared dharmas?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Bhagavān said,🔽“Subhūti, the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the three gateways to liberation, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct knowledge, the four special modes of knowledge, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, great compassion, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of perfect knowledge, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and great compassion—🔽these are called the unshared dharmas of a tathāgata.

original: rab 'byor byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ste /
translated: The thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha—

original: de dag ni thun mong ma yin pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni thun mong ma yin pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: these are called the uncommon dharmas.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni rtog pa med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad @184b la chags par mi bya zhing /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni rtog pa med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad @184b la chags par mi bya zhing /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not get attached to any dharmas at all, because all dharmas are empty of their own marks.🔽All dharmas should be realized in the way of nonduality.”

original: chos thams cad ni gnyis su med pa'i tshul du rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i dmigs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gnyis su med pa'i tshul du rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i dmigs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the object of accomplishment.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba gang brjod pa ci'i slad du /🔽bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba gang brjod pa ci'i slad du / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Why is it said, Bodhisattva, Bodhisattva?

original: rab 'byor 'di la sems can gyi phung po chen po dang sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog nyid du byed par 'gyur ba de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la sems can gyi phung po chen po dang sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog nyid du byed par 'gyur ba de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The Lord: Here the Bodhisattva, the great being, is the chief of the great multitude of beings, the leader of the great multitude of beings, the protector of the great multitude of beings, the lord of the great multitude of beings, the teacher of the great multitude of beings.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi mchog nyid du byed par 'gyur ba sems can gyi phung po chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po de gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi mchog nyid du byed par 'gyur ba sems can gyi phung po chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po de gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subhuti: What is the great multitude of beings, the great multitude of beings of which the Bodhisattva, the great being, is the chief, the leader, the protector, the lord, the teacher?

original: rab 'byor sems can gyi phung po chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems can gyi phung po chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The Lord: The great multitude of beings, the great multitude of beings is this:
