original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di snyam du bdag gis 'khor ba dpag tu med pa sems can thams cad kyi don du go cha bgos nas bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtang bar byas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di snyam du bdag gis 'khor ba dpag tu med pa sems can thams cad kyi don du go cha bgos nas bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtang bar byas so //
translated: “Subhūti, here a bodhisattva mahāsattva, for the sake of all sentient beings, having donned the armor for immeasurable saṃsāra, should think, ‘I will give away all my possessions.

original: @185a * // bdag gis sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: @185a * // bdag gis sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will generate the sameness of mind toward all sentient beings.

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o //
translated: I will lead all sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa through the three vehicles.

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang sems can gang yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang sems can gang yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Even though I lead all sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa, no sentient being at all will have attained complete nirvāṇa.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag gis chos thams cad skye ba med par rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis chos thams cad skye ba med par rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: I will realize that all phenomena are non-arisen.’

original: bdag gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems ma 'dres pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems ma 'dres pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya'o //
translated: I should practice the six perfections with a mind that is not mixed with the thought of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bdag gis chos thams cad rjes su rtogs pa thams cad du song ba la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis chos thams cad rjes su rtogs pa thams cad du song ba la bslab par bya'o //
translated: I should train in the realization of all dharmas that has gone everywhere.

original: bdag gis chos rnams kyi tshul gcig tu mngon par sgrub pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis chos rnams kyi tshul gcig tu mngon par sgrub pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: I should realize the accomplishment of the single principle of dharmas.

original: bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du chos rnams la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du chos rnams la bslab par bya'o //
translated: I should train in dharmas for the sake of realizing the accomplishment of the perfections.

original: bdag gis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun mngon par sgrub pa rtogs pa'i don du chos rnams la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun mngon par sgrub pa rtogs pa'i don du chos rnams la bslab par bya'o //
translated: I should train in dharmas for the sake of realizing the accomplishment of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: bdag gis bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du chos rnams la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du chos rnams la bslab par bya'o //
translated: I should train in dharmas for the sake of realizing the accomplishment of the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇīs, the immeasurable concentrations, the formless absorptions, and the clairvoyances.

original: bdag gis stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mngon par sgrub pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du chos rnams la bslab par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed de /
analyzed: bdag gis stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mngon par sgrub pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du chos rnams la bslab par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed de /
translated: I should train in the dharmas in order to realize the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.”

original: rab 'byor 'di ni gang la gnas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni gang la gnas nas /
translated: Subhūti, this is the vajra-like thought

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog nyid du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed par 'gyur ba rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog nyid du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed par 'gyur ba rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa yin no //
translated: on which the bodhisattva great beings stand and become the best of a great mass of beings, of a great collection of beings, by way of not apprehending anything.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di snyam du sems can dmyal ba pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can ji snyed cig gis sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba de dag gi don du sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba de bdag gis nyams su myong bar @185b bya'o snyam du sems bskyed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di snyam du sems can dmyal ba pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can ji snyed cig gis sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba de dag gi don du sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba de bdag gis nyams su myong bar @185b bya'o snyam du sems bskyed do //
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings should arouse the following thought: ‘For the sake of all those sentient beings in the hells, in the animal realm, and in the world of Yama, who experience the feelings of suffering, I will experience that feeling of suffering.’

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems bskyed par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems bskyed par bya ba ni /
translated: “In this regard, the bodhisattva great beings should arouse the following thought:

original: 'di ltar ji srid du /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid du /
translated: ‘For as long as

original: sems can de dag phung po lhag ma med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du bdag gis sems can re re'i don du yang bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang por de dag phung po lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su mya ngan las
analyzed: sems can de dag phung po lhag ma med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du bdag gis sems can re re'i don du yang bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang por de dag phung po lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su mya ngan las
translated: those sentient beings have not attained nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates, for the sake of each and every sentient being, I will experience the feeling of suffering for many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of eons, until they have attained nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: 'das kyi bar du sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar bya'o snyam zhing tshul 'di nyid kyis sems can thams cad phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du sems can thams cad kyi don du sems
analyzed: 'das kyi bar du sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar bya'o snyam zhing tshul 'di nyid kyis sems can thams cad phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du sems can thams cad kyi don du sems
translated: I will experience the sufferings of the hells, the animal world, and the world of Yama until the end of time.

original: can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal de dag thams cad nyams su myong bar byas te /
analyzed: can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal de dag thams cad nyams su myong bar byas te /
translated: With this very method, I will experience all the sufferings of the hells and so forth for the sake of all sentient beings until all sentient beings have attained complete nirvana in the expanse of nirvana without remainder.

original: de nas gdod bdag gi don du dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed de /
analyzed: de nas gdod bdag gi don du dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed de /
translated: Then, for my own sake, I will generate the roots of virtue.🔽After gathering the accumulations for enlightenment for many quintillions of eons, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas byang chub kyi tshogs bsags nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas byang chub kyi tshogs bsags nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: In this way, you should generate the awakening mind.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni gang gis sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog nyid du byed par 'gyur pa rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni gang gis sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog nyid du byed par 'gyur pa rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, this is the vajra-like generation of the thought that will make one the foremost of a great mass of beings, of a great collection of beings.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems bskyed pa gang gis sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur bar bya ba rlabs po che'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems bskyed pa gang gis sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur bar bya ba rlabs po che'i sems su bya'o //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being should have a vast thought, a thought that will make him foremost of all beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems rlabs po che ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems rlabs po che ni 'di yin te /
translated: And what is a bodhisattva great being’s vast thought?

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung nas 'dod chags kyi sems mi bskyed /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung nas 'dod chags kyi sems mi bskyed /
translated: From the time he first begins his spiritual pursuits, he does not generate a thought of desire,

original: zhe sdang gi sems mi bskyed /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi sems mi bskyed /
translated: does not generate a thought of anger,

original: gti mug gi sems mi bskyed /
analyzed: gti mug gi sems mi bskyed /
translated: does not generate a thought of ignorance,

original: brtse ba'i sems mi bskyed /
analyzed: brtse ba'i sems mi bskyed /
translated: does not generate a thought of love,

original: nyan thos kyi sems dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems kyang mi bskyed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems kyang mi bskyed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: and does not generate a thought of a śrāvaka or a pratyekabuddha.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni gang gis sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid du byed kyang des rlom sems su mi byed pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems rlabs po che'o //🔽rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mi sgul @186a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni gang gis sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid du byed kyang des rlom sems su mi byed pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems rlabs po che'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mi sgul @186a * //
translated: “Subhūti, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ vast thought, which makes them the best of all beings, and yet they do not get conceited about it.

original: pa'i sems dang ldan par bya ste /
analyzed: pa'i sems dang ldan par bya ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should have a thought that does not waver.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi sgul ba nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi sgul ba nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva great beings’ thought that does not waver is this:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa yid la byed cing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa yid la byed cing /
translated: they attend to the thought associated with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: des rlom sems su mi byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: and yet they do not get conceited about it.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni gang gis sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid du 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi sgul ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni gang gis sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid du 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi sgul ba'o //
translated: “Subhūti, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ thought that does not waver, which makes them the best of all beings.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should arouse a mind that is helpful and happy for all beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phan pa dang / bde ba'i sems ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phan pa dang / bde ba'i sems ni 'di yin te /
translated: In that respect, the bodhisattva great beings’ helpful and happy mind is this:

original: sems can thams cad skyob cing sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba gang yin pa des kyang rlom sems su 'gyur ba med pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad skyob cing sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba gang yin pa des kyang rlom sems su 'gyur ba med pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: it is the protection of all beings, the nonabandonment of all beings, and it is also the absence of conceit about that.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni gang la gnas na sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog tu de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phan pa dang / bde ba'i sems so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni gang la gnas na sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog tu de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phan pa dang / bde ba'i sems so //
translated: Subhūti, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ helpful and happy mind, standing in which they become the best of a great mass of beings, the best of a great collection of beings, by way of not apprehending anything.”🔽“Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should arouse a mind that is helpful and happy for all beings.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni chos la dga' ba dang / chos la kun dga' ba'i rnal 'byor la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni chos la dga' ba dang / chos la kun dga' ba'i rnal 'byor la brtson par bya'o //
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should apply themselves to the yoga of delighting in the Dharma and enjoying the Dharma.

original: de la chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the Dharma?

original: chos thams cad dbyer med pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad dbyer med pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the indivisibility of all phenomena.

original: 'di ni chos zhes bya'o //🔽de la chos la dga' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni chos zhes bya'o // de la chos la dga' ba gang zhe na /
translated: This is called the Dharma.🔽“What is delighting in the Dharma?

original: chos la mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos la mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the delight in the Dharma.

original: 'di ni chos la dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos la dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called delighting in the Dharma.

original: de la chos la kun dga' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos la kun dga' ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is enjoying the Dharma?

original: chos sgom zhing mang du byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos sgom zhing mang du byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the cultivation and practice of the Dharma.

original: 'di ni chos la kun dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos la kun dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called enjoying the Dharma.

original: de la chos la dga' ba dang / kun dga' ba'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos la dga' ba dang / kun dga' ba'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is applying oneself to the yoga of delighting in the Dharma and enjoying the Dharma?

original: mngon par sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par sbyor ba ste /
translated: It is the application.

original: 'di ni chos la dga' ba dang / chos la kun dga' ba'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos la dga' ba dang / chos la kun dga' ba'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called applying oneself to the yoga of delighting in the Dharma and enjoying the Dharma.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sems can gyi phung po chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog nyid du 'gyur ba de mi dmigs pa'i @186b tshul gyis bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sems can gyi phung po chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog nyid du 'gyur ba de mi dmigs pa'i @186b tshul gyis bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that should be the best of a great mass of beings, the best of a great collection of beings, by way of not apprehending anything.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas nang stong pa nyid la gnas /🔽phyi stong pa nyid la gnas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas nang stong pa nyid la gnas / phyi stong pa nyid la gnas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should stand in inner emptiness,🔽stand in outer emptiness,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid la gnas /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la gnas /
translated: stand in inner and outer emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la gnas te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la gnas te /
translated: up to stand in the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: sems can gyi phung po chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog tu 'gyur bar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi phung po chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog tu 'gyur bar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bya'o //
translated: and be the best of a great mass of beings, the best of a great collection of beings, by way of not apprehending anything.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la gnas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la gnas /
translated: should stand in the dharmas on the side of awakening,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la gnas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la gnas te /
translated: stand in the ten tathāgata powers, four fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: sems can gyi phung po chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog tu 'gyur bar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi phung po chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog tu 'gyur bar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bya'o //
translated: and, without apprehending anything, become the foremost of the great mass of beings, the great collection of beings.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas /🔽nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas /
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas /🔽nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas /
translated: should stand in the heroic stride meditative stabilization,🔽and, without apprehending anything, become the foremost of the great mass of beings, the great collection of beings.

original: rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar la gnas te /
analyzed: rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar la gnas te /
translated: up to and including the meditative absorption of complete liberation and nonattachment,

original: sems can gyi phung po chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog nyid du 'gyur bar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi phung po chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog nyid du 'gyur bar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bya ste /
translated: and the foremost of a great mass of sentient beings and a great collection of sentient beings.🔽Subhūti, abiding in those dharmas,

original: rab 'byor chos de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos 'di dag la gnas te /
analyzed: chos 'di dag la gnas te /
translated: abide in those dharmas

original: sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog nyid du 'gyur bar bya ba yin no /
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog nyid du 'gyur bar bya ba yin no /
translated: and become the foremost of a great mass of sentient beings and a great collection of sentient beings.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes brjod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes brjod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, they are called bodhisattva great beings.”

original: sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid du sems dpa'i sems chen po nyid do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid du sems dpa'i sems chen po nyid do //
translated: It is the great mind of a being who is the foremost of all sentient beings.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra🔽said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: “Lord, it is amazing🔽how much the bodhisattva great beings have done for beings🔽when they have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”🔽“So it is, Śāriputra, so it is.

original: bcom ldan 'das don gang gi slad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das don gang gi slad du /
translated: Blessed One, I am also

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba de la bdag kyang @187a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba de la bdag kyang @187a * //
translated: confident in the meaning for which the bodhisattva great beings are called ‘great beings.’

original: spobs so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: spobs so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Śāriputra, be confident in the meaning for which the bodhisattva great beings are called ‘great beings.’

original: sh'a ri'i bu don gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes brjod pa la khyod spobs par byos shig / sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / srog tu lta ba dang / skye ba por lta ba dang / gso bar lta ba dang / skyes bur lta ba dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu don gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes brjod pa la khyod spobs par byos shig / sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / srog tu lta ba dang / skye ba por lta ba dang / gso bar lta ba dang / skyes bur lta ba dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang /
translated: ” Śāriputra said,

original: shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba por lta ba dang / chad par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba dang / yod par lta ba dang / med par lta ba dang /
analyzed: shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba por lta ba dang / chad par lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba dang / yod par lta ba dang / med par lta ba dang /
translated: “Blessed One, I am confident in the view of a self, the view of a sentient being, the view of a life-force, the view of a person, the view of an individual, the view of a human being, the view of a human, the view of one who does, the view of one who feels, the view of one who knows, the view of one who sees, the view of annihilation, the view of permanence, the view of existence, and the view of nonexistence.

original: phung por lta ba dang / khams su lta ba dang / skye mched du lta ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar lta ba dang / pha rol tu phyin par lta ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos su lta ba dang /
analyzed: phung por lta ba dang / khams su lta ba dang / skye mched du lta ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar lta ba dang / pha rol tu phyin par lta ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos su lta ba dang /
translated: They are the view of the aggregates, the view of the elements, the view of the sense sources, the view of dependent origination, the view of the perfections, the view of the factors of awakening,

original: stobs dang / mi 'jigs par lta ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar du lta ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya bar lta ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar lta ba dang / byang chub rnam par rtog par lta ba dang /
analyzed: stobs dang / mi 'jigs par lta ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar du lta ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya bar lta ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar lta ba dang / byang chub rnam par rtog par lta ba dang /
translated: the view of the powers and fearlessnesses, up to the view of the unique qualities of the Buddha, the view of bringing sentient beings to maturity, the view of purifying a buddhafield, the view of conceptualizing awakening,

original: sangs rgyas su lta ba dang / chos su lta ba dang / dge 'dun du lta ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar lta ba rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su lta ba dang / chos su lta ba dang / dge 'dun du lta ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar lta ba rnams te /
translated: the view of the Buddha, the view of the Dharma, the view of the Saṅgha, and the view of turning the wheel of the Dharma.

original: lta ba 'di dag thams cad rab tu spang ba'i slad du /
analyzed: lta ba 'di dag thams cad rab tu spang ba'i slad du /
translated: In order to completely abandon all these views,

original: sems can rnams la chos ston par bgyid kyang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bgyid de /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston par bgyid kyang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bgyid de /
translated: they teach the Dharma to sentient beings, but they do so without apprehending anything.

original: de'i slad du /
analyzed: de'i slad du /
translated: For this reason,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi'o //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi'o // de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: he is called a bodhisattva great being.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ci'i phyir na /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs su lta bar 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs su lta bar 'gyur ba yin /
translated: Why is it that bodhisattva great beings come to view form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par lta bar 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par lta bar 'gyur ba nas /
translated: and come to view feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, and so on, up to

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i bar du lta bar 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i bar du lta bar 'gyur ba yin /
translated: why is it that they come to view the turning of the wheel of the sacred doctrine?

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: ” He replied, “Venerable Su­bhūti! Here bodhisattva great beings, when practicing the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mi mkhas pas gzugs su dmigs shing /
analyzed: thabs mi mkhas pas gzugs su dmigs shing /
translated: without skill in means, apprehend form,

original: dmigs pa'i tshul @187b gyis lta ba bskyed do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul @187b gyis lta ba bskyed do //
translated: and on account of that apprehension, they give rise to views.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par dmigs shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lta ba bskyed do /🔽de bzhin du rgya cher skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i bar du dmigs shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lta ba bskyed do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par dmigs shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lta ba bskyed do / de bzhin du rgya cher skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar so so ba dang / bsdus pa'i bar du dmigs shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lta ba bskyed do //
translated: They generate views by objectifying and objectifying in the manner of objectification the aggregates of form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.🔽Similarly, they generate views by objectifying and objectifying in the manner of objectification the various and combined bases, elements, and dependent originations.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: Similarly, they generate views by objectifying and objectifying in the manner of objectification the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural powers, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the eightfold noble path.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / yi ge rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams su dmigs shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lta ba bskyed do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / yi ge rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams su dmigs shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lta ba bskyed do //
translated: They generate views that apprehend the perfections, the letters, the meditative stabilities, the immeasurables, the formless meditative absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang /
translated: the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, the higher perceptions, the meditative stabilities, the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres par dmigs shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lta ba bskyed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres par dmigs shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lta ba bskyed do //
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and they generate views that apprehend them in a manner of apprehending.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i bar du dmigs shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lta ba bskyed do //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i bar du dmigs shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lta ba bskyed do //
translated: They generate views that apprehend the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, and they generate views that apprehend it in a manner of apprehending.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs su lta bar 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs su lta bar 'gyur ba yin /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, for that reason bodhisattva great beings will have a view of form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par lta bar 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par lta bar 'gyur ba yin /
translated: will have a view of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i bar du lta bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i bar du lta bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: and will have a view of turning the wheel of the Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: There, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: thabs mkhas pas /🔽lta ba'i rnam pa de dag spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas / lta ba'i rnam pa de dag spang ba'i phyir /
translated: with skillful means🔽they teach the Dharma by way of not apprehending anything in order to abandon those views.

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston to zhes bya ba ni spong ba chen po nyid do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston to zhes bya ba ni spong ba chen po nyid do //
translated: This is the great abandonment.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das don gang gi slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @188a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das don gang gi slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @188a * //
translated: “Lord, for the sake of what meaning is a bodhisattva great being called a ‘bodhisattva’?

original: zhes bgyi ba de la bdag kyang spobs so //
analyzed: zhes bgyi ba de la bdag kyang spobs so //
translated: I too have confidence to speak about it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, you generate confidence.”

original: rab 'byor khyod kyis spobs pa skyed cig / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod kyis spobs pa skyed cig / rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi sems dang mi mnyam pa dang / mnyam pa'i sems nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma lags pa'i sems /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi sems dang mi mnyam pa dang / mnyam pa'i sems nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma lags pa'i sems /
translated: “Lord, that thought of awakening, that thought equal to the unequalled, that thought not in common with all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: zag pa ma mchis shing khams gsum du ma gtogs pa'i sems gang lags pa de la yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i slad du /
analyzed: zag pa ma mchis shing khams gsum du ma gtogs pa'i sems gang lags pa de la yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i slad du /
translated: that thought that is uncontaminated and not included in the three realms, that thought is empty of intrinsic nature.

original: chags pa ma mchis pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba'i grangs su mchi'o //
analyzed: chags pa ma mchis pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba'i grangs su mchi'o //
translated: Because of that nonattachment, it is counted as the thought of a bodhisattva great being.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar sems de ni sems ma lags te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems de ni sems ma lags te /
translated: Because that thought is not a thought.

original: des na de la chags pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: des na de la chags pa ma mchis so //
translated: Therefore, there is no attachment to it.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i sems gang yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i sems gang yin /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ mind that is equal to the unequaled, the mind that is not shared in common with all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,🔽“Venerable Śāriputra, here, starting from the first production of the thought of awakening,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /🔽chos 'ga' yang skye ba'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste / chos 'ga' yang skye ba'am /
translated: bodhisattva great beings do not see any dharma that arises🔽or ceases.

original: 'gag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'gag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see any dharma that increases

original: 'phel ba'am / 'grib pa'am /
analyzed: 'phel ba'am / 'grib pa'am /
translated: or decreases,

original: 'ong ba'am / 'gro ba 'am /
analyzed: 'ong ba'am / 'gro ba 'am /
translated: that comes or goes,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: or that is afflicted or purified.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang la skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa dang / 'phel ba med cing 'grib pa med pa dang / 'ong ba med cing 'gro ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing rnam par byang ba med pa de la nyan thos kyi sems med do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang la skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa dang / 'phel ba med cing 'grib pa med pa dang / 'ong ba med cing 'gro ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing rnam par byang ba med pa de la nyan thos kyi sems med do //
translated: and which is neither defiled nor purified, there is no thought of the śrāvakas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems med do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems med do //
translated: There is no thought of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, this is the thought of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, which is equal to the unequaled,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i sems so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i sems so //
translated: and which is not shared in common with all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang khyod kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang khyod kyis 'di skad du /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti, you have said,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems zag pa med pa khong du chud pa med pa'i @188b sems de la yang chags pa med do zhes gang smras pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems zag pa med pa khong du chud pa med pa'i @188b sems de la yang chags pa med do zhes gang smras pa /
translated: ‘In that thought of omniscience, which is uncontaminated and not fully understood, there is no attachment.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs la chags pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs la chags pa med pa yin nam /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, is it because of the emptiness of inherent existence that form is not something to be attached to?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yang chags pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yang chags pa med pa yin nam /
translated: Is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness also not something to be attached to?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang chags pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang chags pa med pa yin nam /
translated: Is the knowledge of all aspects also not something to be attached to?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin te /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin te /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Śāriputra, it is so!

original: gzugs kyang chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyang chags pa med pa'o //
translated: Form is also not something to be attached to.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang chags pa med pa'o //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are also not something to be attached to.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i bar yang chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i bar yang chags pa med pa'o //
translated: Up to the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination are also not something to be attached to.

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang chags pa med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang chags pa med do //
translated: The concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions are also not something to be attached to.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar yang chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar yang chags pa med pa'o //
translated: up to the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are unattached.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar yang chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar yang chags pa med pa'o //
translated: up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are unattached.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang chags pa med pa'o //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects is unattached.”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor khyod kyis 'di skad du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems de yang zag pa med cing khong du chud pa med pa zhes gang smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor khyod kyis 'di skad du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems de yang zag pa med cing khong du chud pa med pa zhes gang smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra, you have said, ‘Venerable Subhūti, the thought of the knowledge of all aspects is uncontaminated and not included.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sems kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su ma gtogs pa yin nam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sems kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su ma gtogs pa yin nam /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, the thought of foolish ordinary beings is also uncontaminated and not included because of the emptiness of a basic nature, is it not?”

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams thams cad kyi sems kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs sum gtogs pa yin nam /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams thams cad kyi sems kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs sum gtogs pa yin nam /
translated: Are the minds of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and the minds of all the lord buddhas, also uncontaminated and not included within the three realms because of the emptiness of inherent existence?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni de bzhin te /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, it is so!

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi thugs kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med do //🔽nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sems kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med do //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi thugs kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med do // nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sems kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med do //
translated: The minds of foolish ordinary beings are also uncontaminated and not included within the three realms because of the emptiness of inherent existence.🔽The minds of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are also uncontaminated and not included within the three realms because of the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med do //
translated: The minds of the lord buddhas are also uncontaminated and not included within the three realms because of the emptiness of inherent existence.”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de ltar yin na /🔽gzugs kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med @189a * //
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de ltar yin na / gzugs kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med @189a * //
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra, if that is so,

original: cing khongs su ma gtogs pa yin nam /
analyzed: cing khongs su ma gtogs pa yin nam /
translated: then form is also uncontaminated and not included in the three realms because of the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su ma gtogs pa yin nam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su ma gtogs pa yin nam /
translated: Are feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness also uncontaminated and not included in the three realms because of the emptiness of inherent existence?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med pa yin nam /
translated: Are the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha also uncontaminated and not included in the three realms because of the emptiness of inherent existence?”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med pa yin nam /
translated: up to and the knowledge of all modes is without outflows and not included, because of the emptiness of own-being?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhuti:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: So it is, Venerable Sariputra, as you say.

original: gzugs kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med do //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med do // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med do //
translated: Form is without outflows and not included, because of the emptiness of own-being.🔽Feeling, perception, impulse, and consciousness are without outflows and not included, because of the emptiness of own-being.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa med cing khongs su chud pa med do //
translated: Up to the knowledge of all modes is without outflows and not included, because of the emptiness of own-being.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du sems med pa'i phyir sems de la yang chags pa med do zhes smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du sems med pa'i phyir sems de la yang chags pa med do zhes smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra, you have said, ‘Because it is a non-existent mind, that mind is also unattached.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gzugs kyang gzugs med pa la chags pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gzugs kyang gzugs med pa la chags pa med pa yin nam /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, is form also unattached to formlessness?

original: tshor ba yang tshor ba med pa la chags pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: tshor ba yang tshor ba med pa la chags pa med pa yin na /
translated: Is feeling also unattached to non-feeling?

original: 'du shes kyang 'du shes med pa la chags pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'du shes kyang 'du shes med pa la chags pa med pa yin nam /
translated: Is perception also unattached to non-perception?

original: 'du byed rnams kyang 'du byed med pa la chags pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang 'du byed med pa la chags pa med pa yin nam /
translated: Are volitions also unattached to non-volitions?

original: rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa med pa la chags pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa med pa la chags pa med pa yin nam /
translated: Is consciousness also unattached to non-consciousness?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med pa la chags pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bar yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med pa la chags pa med pa yin nam /
translated: Are the dharmas on the side of awakening also unattached to non-dharmas on the side of awakening?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams med pa la chags pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams med pa la chags pa med pa yin nam /
translated: Are the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha also unattached to the nonexistence of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid med pa la chags pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid med pa la chags pa med pa yin nam /
translated: Is the knowledge of all aspects also unattached to the nonexistence of the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ji skad smas pa de de @189b bzhin te /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ji skad smas pa de de @189b bzhin te /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra, it is just as you have said.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs kyang gzugs med pa la chags pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs kyang gzugs med pa la chags pa med pa yin no //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, form is also unattached to the nonexistence of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa la chags pa med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa la chags pa med do //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are also unattached to consciousness.

original: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar /'byung ba so so ba dang / bsdus pa rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa med pa la chags pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar /'byung ba so so ba dang / bsdus pa rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa med pa la chags pa med do //
translated: Likewise, the elements, the sense fields, the individual and combined aspects of dependent origination, the meditative concentrations, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless meditative absorptions, and consciousness are not attached to the absence of consciousness.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams med pa la chags pa med do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams med pa la chags pa med do //
translated: The perfections, the superknowledges, the factors of awakening, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the aspects of correct understanding, and the distinct qualities of the Buddha are not attached to the absence of the distinct qualities of the Buddha.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni byang chub kyi sems mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sems nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni byang chub kyi sems mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sems nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong
translated: The bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom in this way has the thought of awakening, the thought equal to the unequaled, the thought not shared in common with all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: ma yin pa'i sems des kyang chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rlom sems su 'gyur ba med mngon par chags par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: ma yin pa'i sems des kyang chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rlom sems su 'gyur ba med mngon par chags par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: With that thought, he does not falsely project anything and does not become attached to anything, because of not apprehending anything.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa chen po nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa chen po nyid do //
translated: Therefore, he is called a bodhisattva great being.” This is the greatness of realization.

original: 'di dag gis ni sgrub pa'i ched du bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni sgrub pa'i ched du bya ba bstan to //
translated: These passages show the purpose of practice.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra said to the Blessed One:🔽“Blessed One, the bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom in this way are practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das don gang gi slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba de la bdag kyang spobs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das don gang gi slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba de la bdag kyang spobs so //
translated: Blessed One, I too am confident to speak about the meaning of why a bodhisattva great being is so called.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gang po khyod kyis spobs pa skyed cig / gang pos gsol pa /
analyzed: gang po khyod kyis spobs pa skyed cig / gang pos gsol pa /
translated: “Pūrṇa, you may speak.” Pūrṇa said,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni go cha chen po bgos pa'i sems can lags te /🔽bcom ldan 'das de ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can lags la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni go cha chen po bgos pa'i sems can lags te / bcom ldan 'das de ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can lags la /
translated: “Blessed One, they are beings who have donned the great armor.🔽Blessed One, they are beings who have set out in the Great Vehicle.

original: de ni theg pa chen por yang dag par gnas pa'i sems can lags te /
analyzed: de ni theg pa chen por yang dag par gnas pa'i sems can lags te /
translated: They are beings who abide in the Great Vehicle.

original: de'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi'o //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po la @190a * //
analyzed: de'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi'o // de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po la @190a * //
translated: That is why they are called bodhisattva great beings.”🔽Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra,

original: 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: “Pūrṇa,

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha chen po bgos zhes bya /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha chen po bgos zhes bya /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, to what extent is it said that a bodhisattva mahāsattva has donned the great armor?”

original: gang pos smras pa /
analyzed: gang pos smras pa /
translated: Pūrṇa said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni byang chub kyi don du spyod pa na sems can nyung zad nyi che zhig gi don du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa yongs su gtong🔽ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni byang chub kyi don du spyod pa na sems can nyung zad nyi che zhig gi don du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba ma yin gyi /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, here bodhisattva mahāsattvas, when practicing for the sake of enlightenment, do not abide in the perfection of generosity and give gifts for the sake of just a few sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: They give gifts while abiding in the perfection of generosity for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi don du spyod pa na sems can nyi tshe ba zhig gi don du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi don du spyod pa na sems can nyi tshe ba zhig gi don du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Similarly, when practicing for the sake of enlightenment, they do not abide in the perfection of discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom for the sake of just a few sentient beings.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sems can thams cad kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sems can thams cad kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
translated: He does not stand in the perfection of meditative absorption and cultivate the perfection of meditative absorption, nor does he stand in the perfection of wisdom and cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: pa sgom par byed do //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can 'di snyed cig ni phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o //🔽sems can 'di snyed cig ni yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar mi bya'o zhe'am /🔽sems can 'di snyed cig ni byang chub tu dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: pa sgom par byed do // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can 'di snyed cig ni phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o // sems can 'di snyed cig ni yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar mi bya'o zhe'am / sems can 'di snyed cig ni byang chub tu dgod par bya'o //
translated: But he does stand in the perfection of wisdom for the sake of all beings and cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems can 'di snyed cig ni byang chub tu dgod par mi bya'o zhes sems can yongs su bcad pas go cha mi gyon gyi /
analyzed: sems can 'di snyed cig ni byang chub tu dgod par mi bya'o zhes sems can yongs su bcad pas go cha mi gyon gyi /
