original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed /
translated: purifies the buddhafields,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed kyang /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed kyang /
translated: and ripens beings,

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung /
translated: but he does not have the notion of a buddhafield,

original: sems can gyi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung /
translated: he does not have the notion of a being,

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: and he does not have the notion of a buddha.

original: de gnyis su med pa'i sa la gnas shing /
analyzed: de gnyis su med pa'i sa la gnas shing /
translated: He stands in the stage of nonduality,

original: lus ji lta bus sems can rnams kyi don bya ba'i mthu yod pa de lta bu'i lus ched du bsam zhing yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: lus ji lta bus sems can rnams kyi don bya ba'i mthu yod pa de lta bu'i lus ched du bsam zhing yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: and he deliberately takes on a body in order to have the power to work for the welfare of beings in whatever way is necessary.

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob par ma gyur gyi bar du theg pa chen po de dang nam yang mi 'bral lo zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob par ma gyur gyi bar du theg pa chen po de dang nam yang mi 'bral lo zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Until he has attained the knowledge of a knower of all aspects, he is never separated from the Great Vehicle.

original: des rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob nas kyang /
analyzed: des rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob nas kyang /
translated: And when he has attained the knowledge of a knower of all aspects,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang /
translated: He turned the wheel of Dharma that cannot be turned back by all the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans,

original: mi ma yin pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis bskor bar mi nus pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis bskor bar mi nus pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro //
translated: and non-humans of the world.

original: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: in the east, in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa rnams yon tan brjod pa mdzad cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa rnams yon tan brjod pa mdzad cing /
translated: the lord buddhas proclaimed his qualities.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams che ge mo zhig tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po che ge mo zhes bya ba zhig theg pa chen po bla na med pa'i theg pa theg pa'i mchog la 'dzegs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams che ge mo zhig tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po che ge mo zhes bya ba zhig theg pa chen po bla na med pa'i theg pa theg pa'i mchog la 'dzegs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //
translated: In such and such a world system, the bodhisattva mahāsattva named so-and-so, having mounted the unexcelled vehicle of the Great Vehicle, the supreme vehicle, has attained the state of omniscience.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byed do zhes grags pa sgrog cing dbyangs su brjod pa mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byed do zhes grags pa sgrog cing dbyangs su brjod pa mdzad do //
translated: Having attained omniscience, he turns the wheel of the Dharma.

original: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub @202a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub @202a * //
translated: In the same way, in the south, west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest,

original: byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing /
analyzed: byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing /
translated: below and above, in each direction,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Ganges River,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa rnams yon tan brjod pa mdzad cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa rnams yon tan brjod pa mdzad cing /
translated: the blessed buddhas proclaim the qualities of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams che ge mo zhig tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po che ge mo zhes bya ba zhig / theg pa chen po bla na med pa'i theg pa theg pa'i mchog la 'dzegs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams che ge mo zhig tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po che ge mo zhes bya ba zhig / theg pa chen po bla na med pa'i theg pa theg pa'i mchog la 'dzegs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //
translated: In such and such a world system, the bodhisattva mahāsattva named so-and-so, having mounted the Great Vehicle, the unsurpassed vehicle, the vehicle that is foremost among vehicles, has attained the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byed do zhes grags pa sgrog cing dbyangs su brjod pa mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byed do zhes grags pa sgrog cing dbyangs su brjod pa mdzad do //
translated: Having attained the knowledge of all aspects, he has set in motion the wheel of the Dharma.🔽In this way, Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva is said to be mounting the Great Vehicle.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par 'dzeg pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par 'dzeg pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug pa'o //
translated: This is the entry into the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di dag gis ni 'jug pa'i sgrub pa bstan to /🔽// / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni 'jug pa'i sgrub pa bstan to / // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: This shows the accomplishment of entry.🔽Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das go cha chen po bgos pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das go cha chen po bgos pa /
translated: Blessed One, it is said that one dons the great armor.

original: go cha chen po bgos pa zhes brjod pa /
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos pa zhes brjod pa /
translated: What is meant by donning the great armor?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha chen po bgos zhes bgyi ba lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha chen po bgos zhes bgyi ba lags /
translated: Blessed One, to what extent is it said that a bodhisattva great being dons the great armor?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos theg pa chen po'i go cha 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos theg pa chen po'i go cha 'di lta ste /
translated: Having been asked this, the Blessed One replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha dang /
translated: “Su­bhūti, here bodhisattva great beings don this great vehicle’s armor, namely, the armor of the transcendent perfection of generosity, the armor of the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline, the armor of the transcendent perfection of tolerance, the armor of the transcendent perfection of perseverance, the armor of the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba'i go cha bgos /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba'i go cha bgos /
translated: and the armor of the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of inner emptiness.

original: phyi stong pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of outer emptiness.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of outer and inner emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the emptiness of emptiness, up to the armor of the emptiness of its own mark.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i go cha bgos /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi @202b go cha bgos /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi @202b go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the path.

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i go cha bgos /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the meditative stabilizations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions.

original: mngon par shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the clairvoyances, the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i go cha bgos nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i go cha bgos nas /
translated: Having donned the armor of the Buddha’s body,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di snang bas rgyas par bkang ste /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di snang bas rgyas par bkang ste /
translated: he filled this world system of a billion worlds with light.

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang bas rgyas par 'gengs so //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang bas rgyas par 'gengs so //
translated: He filled with light as many world systems in the eastern direction as there are sand particles in the Ganges river.

original: lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang pas rgyas par 'gengs so //
analyzed: lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang pas rgyas par 'gengs so //
translated: He filled with light as many world systems in the southern, western, and northern directions, in the nadir and the zenith, in each direction, as there are sand particles in the Ganges river.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam par 'gyur ba drug tu rab tu bskyod do //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam par 'gyur ba drug tu rab tu bskyod do //
translated: He shook this world system of a billion worlds in six ways.

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnam par 'gyur ba drug tu rab tu bskyod do //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnam par 'gyur ba drug tu rab tu bskyod do //
translated: He shook as many world systems in the eastern direction as there are sand particles in the Ganges river in six ways.

original: lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnam par 'gyur ba drug tu rab tu bskyod do //
analyzed: lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnam par 'gyur ba drug tu rab tu bskyod do //
translated: in the south, west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, below and above, in each of the ten directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, shook in six ways.

original: des stong gsum gyi stong chen po 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na sems can dmyal ba'i me'i phung po ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad zhi bar byas shing sems can dmyal ba pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal rab tu bcil nas /
analyzed: des stong gsum gyi stong chen po 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na sems can dmyal ba'i me'i phung po ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad zhi bar byas shing sems can dmyal ba pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal rab tu bcil nas /
translated: All the fires of the hells in this great trichiliocosm were extinguished, and the suffering of the beings in the hells was pacified.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod do //
translated: The sound of the words “Homage to the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One” was heard.

original: dbyangs sgrog go //
analyzed: dbyangs sgrog go //
translated: It was proclaimed.

original: de'i tshe sems can dmyal ba ba'i sems can de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi sgra de thos nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe sems can dmyal ba ba'i sems can de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi sgra de thos nas /
translated: At that time, the beings in the hells, having heard that sound of the Buddha,

original: dga' ba dang / bde ba thob ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / bde ba thob ste /
translated: attain joy and bliss.

original: de dag dga' ba dang bde ba des sems can dmyal ba de dag nas rnam par ldang ngo //🔽de dag sems can dmyal ba de dag nas rnam par langs nas /
analyzed: de dag dga' ba dang bde ba des sems can dmyal ba de dag nas rnam par ldang ngo // de dag sems can dmyal ba de dag nas rnam par langs nas /
translated: Through that joy and bliss, they rise up from the hells.🔽Having risen up from the hells,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang dang @203a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang dang @203a * //
translated: they are reborn in those and those buddha-fields

original: gang nas / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / de dang de dag tu skyes te /
analyzed: gang nas / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / de dang de dag tu skyes te /
translated: where the Blessed Buddhas are dwelling, living, and maintaining themselves.

original: lha dang mi'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: They take up divine and human rebirths.

original: de bzhin du byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can de dag nas rnam par ldang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can de dag nas rnam par ldang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the beings in the animal realms and the beings in the worlds of Yama rise up from there.

original: de dag byol song gi skye gnas dang / 'jig rten de dag nas rnam par langs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang dang gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dang de dag tu skye ste /
analyzed: de dag byol song gi skye gnas dang / 'jig rten de dag nas rnam par langs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang dang gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dang de dag tu skye ste /
translated: They rise up from the animal realm and from those worlds and are reborn in those buddha-fields where the lord buddhas are present, living, and teaching the Dharma.

original: lha dang mi'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: They take up birth as gods and humans.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am /
translated: a magician or

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa zhig lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa zhig lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste /
translated: a magician’s apprentice, having sat down at a crossroads in a town,

original: skye bo mang po'i tshogs kyi mdun du sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dag cig mngon par sprul la /
analyzed: skye bo mang po'i tshogs kyi mdun du sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dag cig mngon par sprul la /
translated: having conjured up a hell realm, an animal realm, and a world of Yama in front of a crowd of people,

original: de ltar mngon par sprul nas ngan song gi sems can de dag la sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / chos kyi sgra dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra sgrogs par gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par sprul nas ngan song gi sems can de dag la sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / chos kyi sgra dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra sgrogs par gyur te /
translated: having conjured them up, would proclaim the words ‘Buddha,’ ‘Dharma,’ and ‘Saṅgha’ to the beings in the lower realms.

original: de nas sprul pa de dag sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / chos kyi sgra dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra nges sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten de dang de dag las rnam par langs par gyur na /
analyzed: de nas sprul pa de dag sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / chos kyi sgra dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra nges sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten de dang de dag las rnam par langs par gyur na /
translated: Then those emanations, with the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, and the sound of the Saṅgha, would cause those sentient beings to rise up from those and those hells, animal rebirths, and worlds of Yama.

original: rab 'byor de la ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de la ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think, Subhūti,

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po dang / sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu de sems can gang yang /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po dang / sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu de sems can gang yang /
translated: would that magician or magician’s apprentice have caused any sentient beings

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten de dag nas rnam par blang pa yod dam /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten de dag nas rnam par blang pa yod dam /
translated: to rise up from those hells, animal rebirths, and worlds of Yama?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so //
translated: “No, Lord,” he replied.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa'i sems can rnams ngan song gsum las yongs su bkrol yang sems can gang yang yongs su grol bar byas pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa'i sems can rnams ngan song gsum las yongs su bkrol yang sems can gang yang yongs su grol bar byas pa med do //
translated: “Even if a bodhisattva great being were to liberate as many sentient beings as there are in the ten directions from the three lower realms, he would not think that he had liberated any sentient beings at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyis de bzhin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab 'byor sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyis de bzhin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because, in terms of the real nature, phenomena are like an illusion.🔽Subhūti, that is why a bodhisattva great being is said to be wearing the great armor.”

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po @203b bgos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i tshogs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po @203b bgos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i tshogs so //
translated: This is the accumulation of compassion.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa ni /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who has donned the great armor

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams bee d'urya'i rgyu las byung ba mngon par sprul par byed do //🔽de ltar bee d'urya'i rgyu las byung ba mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams bee d'urya'i rgyu las byung ba mngon par sprul par byed do // de ltar bee d'urya'i rgyu las byung ba mngon par sprul nas /
translated: Having emanated a great trichiliocosm made of beryl,

original: 'khor los sgyur pa'i bkod pa mngon par sprul par byed do //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur pa'i bkod pa mngon par sprul par byed do //
translated: he emanates the array of a universal monarch.

original: de ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i bkod pa mngon par sprul nas /🔽zas 'dod pa rnams la zas kyi sbyin pa byed do //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i bkod pa mngon par sprul nas / zas 'dod pa rnams la zas kyi sbyin pa byed do //
translated: Having emanated the array of a universal monarch,🔽he gives food to those who desire food.

original: skom 'dod pa rnams la skom /
analyzed: skom 'dod pa rnams la skom /
translated: He gives drink to those who desire drink.

original: bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa /
analyzed: bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa /
translated: He gives vehicles to those who desire vehicles.

original: gos 'dod pa rnams la gos /🔽me tog 'dod pa rnams la me tog / phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la phreng ba /
analyzed: gos 'dod pa rnams la gos / me tog 'dod pa rnams la me tog / phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la phreng ba /
translated: He gives clothing to those who desire clothing.

original: spos 'dod pa rnams la spos /🔽byug pa 'dod pa rnams la byug pa /
analyzed: spos 'dod pa rnams la spos / byug pa 'dod pa rnams la byug pa /
translated: He gives flowers to those who desire flowers. He gives garlands to those who desire garlands.🔽He gives incense to those who desire incense.🔽He gives ointments to those who desire ointments.

original: mal cha 'dod pa rnams la mal cha /
analyzed: mal cha 'dod pa rnams la mal cha /
translated: He gives bedding to those who desire bedding.

original: khyim 'dod pa rnams la khyim /
analyzed: khyim 'dod pa rnams la khyim /
translated: He gives houses to those who desire houses.

original: 'tsho ba 'dod pa rnams la 'tsho ba /
analyzed: 'tsho ba 'dod pa rnams la 'tsho ba /
translated: To those who desire livelihood, livelihood.🔽

original: yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad /
analyzed: yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad /
translated: to those who want provisions, provisions;🔽to those who want necessities, necessities;

original: nad kyi rkyen rtsi dang yo byad 'dod pa rnams la nad kyi rkyen rtsi dang yo byad kyi sbyin pa byed do //🔽nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byi ru dang / gser dang dngul 'dod pa rnams la nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang /
analyzed: nad kyi rkyen rtsi dang yo byad 'dod pa rnams la nad kyi rkyen rtsi dang yo byad kyi sbyin pa byed do // nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byi ru dang / gser dang dngul 'dod pa rnams la nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang /
translated: to those who want medicine and necessities for illness, medicine and necessities for illness.

original: byi ru dang / gser dang dngul gyi sbyin pa byed cing /
analyzed: byi ru dang / gser dang dngul gyi sbyin pa byed cing /
translated: to those who want jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, quartz, coral, gold, and silver, he gives jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, quartz, coral, gold, and silver.

original: mi'i yo byad gang ci yang rung ba'i bar du sbyin par byed /
analyzed: mi'i yo byad gang ci yang rung ba'i bar du sbyin par byed /
translated: He gives whatever human necessities there are.

original: des de ltar zas 'dod pa rnams la zas byin /
analyzed: des de ltar zas 'dod pa rnams la zas byin /
translated: Having given food to those who want food,

original: mi'i yo byad gang ci yang rung ba'i bar du sbyin nas /🔽sems can de dag la chos ston pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i chos bstan pa 'di nyid ston to //

analyzed: sems can de dag gis kyang chos bstan pa de thos nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro//
translated: and those sentient beings, having heard that teaching of the Dharma, would not be separated from the six perfections until they attained the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing ched du bsams te skye ba yongs su bzung bas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs su skye zhing de 'khor los sgyur ba'i dbang phyug de la gnas
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing ched du bsams te skye ba yongs su bzung bas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs su skye zhing de 'khor los sgyur ba'i dbang phyug de la gnas
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of morality, deliberately taking up birth, are born into a royal family of universal monarchs.

original: nas / sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu dgod do //
analyzed: nas / sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu dgod do //
translated: Standing in that universal monarch’s sovereignty, they establish beings in the ten wholesome actions,

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i bar dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i bar dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, up to the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sems can rnams rab tu 'god de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sems can rnams rab tu 'god de /
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sems can de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ma gyur gyi bar du /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ma gyur gyi bar du /
translated: And until those sentient beings have attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment,🔽

original: chos bstan pa de dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /🔽sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am /
analyzed: chos bstan pa de dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro // rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na / sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am /
translated: and those sentient beings will never be separated from that teaching of the Dharma until they have attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa zhig gis /🔽lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa zhig gis / lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste /
translated: “Su­bhūti, it is just as when a magician or the apprentice of a magician🔽has conjured up a large crowd of people

analyzed: skye bo mang po'i tshogs kyi mdun du skye bo mang po'i tshigs shig mngon par sprul te /

analyzed: sems can de dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod dam /
translated: and has established those sentient beings in the ten virtuous actions,

original: sangs @204b rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi par la bkod na /
analyzed: sangs @204b rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi par la bkod na /

original: rab 'byor de la ji snyam du sems /🔽sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor de la ji snyam du sems / sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am /
translated: what do you think, Su­bhūti?

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa des sems can gang yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa yod dam /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa des sems can gang yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa yod dam /
translated: Have those sentient beings been established in the ten virtuous actions by that magician or the apprentice of a magician?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi par la bkod pa yod dam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi par la bkod pa yod dam /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, there are not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can tshad med grangs med pa /
translated: even though bodhisattva great beings establish countless,

analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu bkod de /
translated: immeasurable sentient beings in the ten wholesome actions,

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la bkod kyang /

analyzed: rab 'byor de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
translated: Because, taking the intrinsic nature of illusion as an example,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyis de bzhin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyis de bzhin pa'i phyir te /
translated: the intrinsic nature of phenomena is just like that.🔽Subhūti, such bodhisattva great beings are said to be ‘equipped with the great armor.’ ”

original: rab 'byor de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni go cha chen po bgos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi tshogs so /🔽// / bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni go cha chen po bgos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi tshogs so /🔽// / bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: This is the accumulation of morality.

analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of patience

analyzed: sems can thams cad bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor zhing 'jog la rab tu 'god do // rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of patience connect all beings with the perfection of patience, settle them, and establish them in the perfection of patience.

original: sems can thams cad bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor zhing 'jog la rab tu 'god pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor zhing 'jog la rab tu 'god pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of patience connect all beings with the perfection of patience, settle them, and establish them in the perfection of patience?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar go cha gyon te /

translated: Even if all sentient beings were to strike me with clods, sticks, and swords, I would not get angry even for a moment, and I would rejoice in patience.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:🔽for example,

analyzed: skye bo mang po'i tshogs kyi mdun @205a * //

analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyar zhing gzhog la rab tu 'god pa byas na /

analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa des sems can gang yang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod pa yod dam /
translated: “Did that skilled magician’s apprentice establish any sentient beings in the perfection of patience?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so //
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One, he did not.”

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can tshad med grangs med pa de snyed dag bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod kyang /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, although bodhisattva great beings establish that many countless, immeasurable sentient beings in the perfection of patience,

analyzed: sems can yang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod pa med do //
translated: they do not establish any sentient beings in the perfection of patience.

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: rab 'byor de ni sgyu ma'i chos nyid nyi bar bzung na /
translated: Subhūti, because, when you take the dharmatā of illusion as your guide,🔽the dharmatā of dharmas is just like that. Subhūti, such bodhisattva great beings are said to be wearing the great armor.”

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyis de bzhin pa'i phyir dang / rab 'byor de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'i tshogs so //

translated: This is the accumulation of patience.

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so //

translated: “Furthermore, Subhuti, when Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas abide in the perfection of meditation, they correctly engage, introduce, and establish all beings in the perfection of meditation.

analyzed: rab 'byor de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi tshogs so //

analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos shing /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who have donned the great armor

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing ji ltar bdag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sems can ji snyed 'khod pa de dag thams cad kyang🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor zhing gzhog la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing ji ltar bdag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sems can ji snyed 'khod pa de dag thams cad kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor zhing gzhog la rab tu 'god do //
translated: “They go to the world systems in the east, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, and they cause all the sentient beings who are in those world systems to engage with, to be led to, and to be settled in the perfection of generosity, just as they themselves are settled in the perfection of generosity.

original: ji ltar bdag tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na /

translated: They cause them to engage with, to be led to, and to be settled in the perfection of ethical discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom, just as they themselves are settled in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems can ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par sbyor zhing gzhog la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: sems can ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par sbyor zhing gzhog la rab tu 'god do //
translated: and all those beings are also properly engaged in the perfection of wisdom, are established in it.

original: chos kyang ston te /
analyzed: chos kyang ston te /
translated: And they teach the Dharma

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa 'di nyid do //

original: sems can de dag kyang chos de thos nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang chos de thos nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And those beings, having heard that Dharma, are never separated from the six perfections until they have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / @207a * //
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / @207a * //
translated: to the south, west, north, northeast, southeast,

analyzed: lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing /

original: ji ltar bdag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la gnas pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sems can gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par sbyor zhing gzhog la rab🔽tu 'god do //

translated: “Just as I abide in the perfection of generosity, and abide in the perfection of wisdom, in the same way, in all those world systems, I cause all those sentient beings to be truly established in the perfection of generosity, and to be truly established in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par sbyor zhing gzhog la rab tu 'god do //🔽'di lta ste /

translated: I cause them to be truly established in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di nyid kyi chos kyang ston to //

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will never be separated from the six perfections.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am /
translated: a magician or

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste /
translated: a magician’s apprentice, having sat down at a crossroads in a town,

original: skye bo mang po'i tshogs kyi mdun du /
analyzed: skye bo mang po'i tshogs kyi mdun du /
translated: in front of a crowd of many people,

original: skye bo mang po'i tshogs shig mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: skye bo mang po'i tshogs shig mngon par sprul te /
translated: having conjured up a crowd of many people,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la yang dag par sbyor zhing gzhog la rab tu bkod par gyur na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la yang dag par sbyor zhing gzhog la rab tu bkod par gyur na /
translated: having set them in the six perfections,

original: rab 'byor de la ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de la ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think, Subhūti?

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am /
translated: Did that magician or

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa des sems can gang yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la yang dag par sbyor zhing gzhog la rab tu bkod pa yod dam /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa des sems can gang yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la yang dag par sbyor zhing gzhog la rab tu bkod pa yod dam /
translated: that magician’s apprentice set any beings in the six perfections?”🔽“No indeed, Bhagavan.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so //
translated: Subhūti replied, “No, Blessed One, it would not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'phyor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'phyor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa drug @207b la bkod kyang sems can gang yang pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa drug @207b la bkod kyang sems can gang yang pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, a bodhisattva great being might establish the sentient beings of as many world systems in the eastern direction as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, and likewise the sentient beings of the southern, western, and northern directions, the intermediate directions, the zenith and the nadir, in the ten directions, in each of as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, in the six perfections.

original: drug la bkod pa med do //
analyzed: drug la bkod pa med do //
translated: But still, no sentient being at all would have been established in the six perfections.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: rab 'byor sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
translated: Subhūti, it is because, in terms of the reality of illusion,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyis de bzhin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyis de bzhin pa'i phyir te /
translated: the reality of phenomena is just like that.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being is said to be wearing the great armor.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa ni /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being wearing the great armor

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gnas shing sems bskyed pa gzhan gyi go mi 'byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gnas shing sems bskyed pa gzhan gyi go mi 'byed de /
translated: dwells with a thought endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, and does not open the way for another thought.

original: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par bya'o //
translated: “I will establish this many sentient beings in the perfection of giving,

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not establish this many sentient beings.”

original: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par bya'o //
translated: “I will establish this many sentient beings in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: This much is not to be laughed at.🔽

original: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish this many in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not establish this many.

original: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish this many in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not establish this many.

original: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish this many in the result of stream enterer.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not establish this many.

original: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish this many in the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, and the state of a worthy one.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not establish this many.

original: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig na rang byang chub la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig na rang byang chub la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish this many in individual enlightenment.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not establish this many in the knowledge of all modes.🔽I will establish this many in the knowledge of all modes.

original: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will not establish this many in the knowledge of all modes.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o zhes bya bar sems bskyed pa'i go mi 'byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o zhes bya bar sems bskyed pa'i go mi 'byed kyi /
translated: He does not set up such thoughts.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /🔽bdag gis sems can tshad med grangs med pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par @208a * //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te / bdag gis sems can tshad med grangs med pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par @208a * //
translated: He thinks thus:

original: bya'o // bdag gis sems can tshad med grangs med pa tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: bya'o // bdag gis sems can tshad med grangs med pa tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: I will establish countless, immeasurable beings in the perfection of giving, I will establish countless, immeasurable beings in the perfection of morality, in the perfection of patience, in the perfection of vigour, in the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par bya'o//
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par bya'o//
translated: in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish countless, immeasurable beings in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish them in the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish them in the result of stream enterer.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par bya'o //🔽rang byang chub la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par bya'o // rang byang chub la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish them in the result of once-returner, in the result of non-returner, and in the state of a worthy one.🔽I will establish them in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dgod par bya'o zhes bya bar sems bskyed do zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dgod par bya'o zhes bya bar sems bskyed do zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi tshogs so //
translated: I will establish them in the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is just as if

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am /
translated: an illusionist or

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste /
translated: an apprentice of an illusionist, having sat down on the crossroads of a main road,

original: skye bo mang po'i tshogs kyi mdun du /
analyzed: skye bo mang po'i tshogs kyi mdun du /
translated: in front of a crowd of many people,

original: skye bo mang po'i tshogs shig mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: skye bo mang po'i tshogs shig mngon par sprul te /
translated: and he conjures up a great crowd of people,

original: 'di snyam du bdag gis sems can tshad med grangs med pa 'di dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag gis sems can tshad med grangs med pa 'di dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dgod par bya'o //
translated: and he thinks, ‘I will establish these countless, immeasurable sentient beings in the six perfections,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dgod par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par gyur na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dgod par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed par gyur na /
translated: and I will establish them in the knowledge of all aspects.’

original: rab 'byor de la ji snyam du sems /🔽sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor de la ji snyam du sems / sgyu ma'i mkhan po'am /
translated: What do you think, Subhūti,

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa des /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa des /
translated: have those magicians or the magician’s apprentices

original: sems can gang yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dgod par byas pa yod dam /
analyzed: sems can gang yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dgod par byas pa yod dam /
translated: established any sentient beings in the six perfections,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dgod par byas pa yod dam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dgod par byas pa yod dam /
translated: or established them in the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis so //
translated: He replied, “No, Lord.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that should train in the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can tshad med grangs med pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dgod par sems bskyed kyang /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can tshad med grangs med pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dgod par sems bskyed kyang /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being may arouse the thought to establish countless, immeasurable sentient beings in the six perfections, up to in the knowledge of all aspects,

original: sems can gang gi don du yang sems bskyed pa med do //
analyzed: sems can gang gi don du yang sems bskyed pa med do //
translated: but not for the sake of any sentient being at all does he arouse the thought.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: rab 'byor sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
translated: Subhūti, when you take the real nature of an illusion as your point of reference,

original: chos rnams kyi chos @208b nyid kyis de bzhin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos @208b nyid kyis de bzhin pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is because the real nature of dharmas is just like that.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, that is the great armor that a bodhisattva great being dons.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti then said,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'tshal te /
translated: “Blessed One, I understand the meaning of what the Blessed One has said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /
translated: A bodhisattva great being

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha bgos par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha bgos par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: “For the sake of the emptiness of its own mark, one should know that one has put on the armor of non-armor.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gzugs gzugs kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gzugs gzugs kyis stong ngo //
translated: Blessed One, it is because form is empty of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty of consciousness.

original: mig mig gis stong ngo //
analyzed: mig mig gis stong ngo //
translated: The eyes are empty of the eyes.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yid kyis stong ngo //
translated: Similarly, the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are empty of the thinking mind.

original: gzugs gzugs kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs gzugs kyis stong ngo //
translated: Form is empty of form.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos chos kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos chos kyis stong ngo //
translated: Sound, smell, taste, feeling, and dharmas are empty of dharmas.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa mig gi rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa mig gi rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
translated: Eye consciousness is empty of eye consciousness.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
translated: and the mind consciousness is empty of the mind consciousness.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa mig gi 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa mig gi 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
translated: Eye contact is empty of eye contact.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa yid kyi 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa yid kyi 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
translated: Ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, and mind contact is empty of mind contact.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong ngo //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong ngo //
translated: The feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact is empty of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong ngo //
translated: the feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of nose contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of tongue contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of body contact, and the feeling that arises from the condition of thinking-mind contact is empty of the feeling that arises from the condition of thinking-mind contact.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
translated: The perfection of giving is empty of the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas @209a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas @209a * //
translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom is empty of the perfection of wisdom.

original: stong ngo // nang stong pa nyid nang stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: stong ngo // nang stong pa nyid nang stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: Inner emptiness is empty of inner emptiness.

original: phyi stong pa nyid phyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //🔽phyi nang stong pa nyid phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid phyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo // phyi nang stong pa nyid phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: external emptiness is empty of external emptiness,🔽internal and external emptiness is empty of internal and external emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is empty of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyis stong ngo //
translated: the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are empty of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis stong ngo //
translated: the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: and, Lord, a bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: go cha chen po yang go cha chen pos stong ste /
analyzed: go cha chen po yang go cha chen pos stong ste /
translated: The great armor is empty of the great armor.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des na /
translated: The Lord: For this reason,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha bgos par rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha bgos par rig par bgyi'o //
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should be known as 'armed with the great armour', as 'mounted on the great vehicle'.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord:

original: rab 'byor ji skad du smras pa bzhin te /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor ji skad du smras pa bzhin te / de de bzhin no //
translated: As you say, Subhuti, it is just as you have said.

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just so, Subhuti, it is just so!

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang ma byas mi 'gyur mngon par 'dus ma byas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang ma byas mi 'gyur mngon par 'dus ma byas /
translated: Subhuti, the knowledge of all modes is not made, does not become, is not produced,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang gi don du go cha chen po bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang ma byas mi 'gyur mngon par 'dus ma byas so //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang gi don du go cha chen po bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang ma byas mi 'gyur mngon par 'dus ma byas so // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du /
translated: and those beings for whose sake the Bodhisattva, the great being, has put on the great armour, they too are not made, do not become, are not produced.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma bgyis mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma bgyis mi 'gyur /
translated: Subhuti: For what reason, O Lord, is the knowledge of all modes not made, does not become, is not produced?

original: mngon par 'dus ma bgyis pa lags /
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma bgyis pa lags /
translated: And why are those beings not made, do not become, are not produced?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang gi don du go cha chen po bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang ci'i slad du ma bgyis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang gi don du go cha chen po bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang ci'i slad du ma bgyis /
translated: Why is the perfection of giving not made, does not become, and is not clearly apparent?🔽Why is the perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, perfection of concentration, and perfection of wisdom not made, does not become, and is not clearly apparent?🔽Why is the emptiness of internal not made, does not become, and is not clearly apparent?🔽Why is the emptiness of external, the emptiness of both external and internal, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities not made, does not become, and is not clearly apparent?

original: mi 'gyur mngon par 'dus ma bgyis pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mi 'gyur mngon par 'dus ma bgyis pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Why is the applications of mindfulness not made, does not become, and is not clearly apparent?

original: rab 'byor byed pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab 'byor byed pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: Why is the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path not made, does not become, and is not clearly apparent?🔽Why is the ten powers, four fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, and eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha not made, does not become, and is not clearly apparent?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma byas mi 'gyur /🔽mngon par 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma byas mi 'gyur / mngon par 'dus ma byas so //
translated: Why is the knowledge of all aspects not made, does not become, and is not clearly apparent?🔽Why are those sentient beings for whose sake the bodhisattva great beings don out the great armor not made, do not become, and are not clearly apparent?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi don du go cha chen po bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang ma byas mi 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi don du go cha chen po bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang ma byas mi 'gyur /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, it is because the maker is not apprehended.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is not made, does not become, and is not clearly apparent.

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar gzugs mi @209b byed mi 'gyur /🔽mngon par 'du mi byed do //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi byed mi 'gyur /🔽mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar gzugs mi @209b byed mi 'gyur /🔽mngon par 'du mi byed do //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi byed mi 'gyur /🔽mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: Those sentient beings for whose sake the bodhisattva great beings don out the great armor are not made, do not become, and are not clearly apparent.

original: rab 'byor mig mi byed mi 'gyur mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor mig mi byed mi 'gyur mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: Subhūti, the eye does not make, does not unmake, does not manifest,🔽and does not become manifest.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid mi byed mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid mi byed mi 'gyur /
translated: The ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind do not make, do not unmake,

original: mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: and do not become manifest.

original: rab 'byor gzugs mi byed mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs mi byed mi 'gyur /
translated: Subhūti, form does not make, does not unmake,

original: mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: and does not become manifest.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos mi byed mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos mi byed mi 'gyur /
translated: Sounds, smells, tastes, tangibles, and dharmas do not make, do not unmake,

original: mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: and do not become manifest.

original: rab 'byor mig gi rnam par shes pa mi byed mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rab 'byor mig gi rnam par shes pa mi byed mi 'gyur /
translated: Subhūti, eye consciousness does not make, does not unmake,

original: mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: and does not become manifest.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi byed mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi byed mi 'gyur /
translated: Ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and thinking-mind consciousness do not make, do not unmake,

original: mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: and do not become manifest.

original: rab 'byor mig gi 'dus te reg pa mi byed mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rab 'byor mig gi 'dus te reg pa mi byed mi 'gyur /
translated: Subhūti, eye contact does not make, does not unmake,

original: mngon par 'du mi byed do//
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed do//
translated: and does not become manifest.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa mi byed mi 'gyur /🔽mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa mi byed mi 'gyur / mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: He does not make, does not bring about, does not occasion the contact of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, or thought.

original: rab 'byor mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba mi byed mi 'gyur /🔽mngon par 'du mi byed do //🔽rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba mi byed mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rab 'byor mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba mi byed mi 'gyur / mngon par 'du mi byed do // rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba mi byed mi 'gyur /
translated: He does not make, does not bring about, does not occasion the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the eye,

original: mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the ear, the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the nose, the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the tongue, the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the body, or the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with thought.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de dag ni shin tu med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni shin tu med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are absolutely nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

original: rab 'byor bdag ni mi byed mi 'gyur mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor bdag ni mi byed mi 'gyur mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: Subhūti, I do not make, do not become, and do not form a self.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de shin tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin du sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po mi byed mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de shin tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po mi byed mi 'gyur /
translated: Because it is utterly non-apprehensible.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: Similarly, I do not make, do not become, and do not form a sentient being, a living being, a nourishing being, a man, an individual, a human being, a person, an agent, a feeler, a knower, or a viewer.
